data.text: @LacusCurtius The Oxford Classics curriculum is still called Literae Humaniores - more human letters - so it's still in use, but while I would include Classics within Humanities, I wouldn't want them to be considered synonyms.
@LacusCurtius Possibly “obsolete” in restriction to Gk/Rom. Oxford 2010 gives broader reference, not mentioning Gk/Rom. But gives “classics professor” (=lang/lit of Gk/Rom) as being “dated”.

@LacusCurtius I hope not, because classics are limited to Greece and Rome, while the humanities are a wide pedagogical program. The situation in the USA, where you have liberal arts, may be the equivalent of the humanities, I'm not sure.
